Dictionary.Name: The Collaborative International Dictionary of English v.0.44

Definition.WordDefinition: Roughly \Rough"ly\, adv. In a rough manner; unevenly; harshly; rudely; severely; austerely. [1913 Webster]

roughly adv 1: (of quantities) imprecise but fairly close to correct; "lasted approximately an hour"; "in just about a minute"; "he's about 30 years old"; "I've had about all I can stand"; "we meet about once a month"; "some forty people came"; "weighs around a hundred pounds"; "roughly $3,000"; "holds 3 gallons, more or less"; "20 or so people were at the party" [syn: {approximately}, {about}, {close to}, {just about}, {some}, {more or less}, {around}, {or so}] 2: with roughness or violence (`rough' is an informal variant for `roughly'); "he was pushed roughly aside"; "they treated him rough" [syn: {rough}] 3: with rough motion as over a rough surface; "ride rough" [syn: {rough}]
